intro: Eutrema hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to saline and wind-exposed environments. Eutrema hookeri is often found in dune habitats and is an important component of coastal vegetation in its native range.
